alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 11 at 5:02AM CDT until July 11 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Bryan County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northern Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 501 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Connerville to near Tishomingo to 3 miles west of Madill, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Durant, Madill, Atoka, Tishomingo, Caddo, Mannsville, Bokchito, Ravia, Wapanucka, Bennington, Silo, Milburn, Tushka, Caney, Kenefic, Bromide, Mead, Armstrong, Fillmore, and Reagan. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
